sentence.Network_cn: 奥兰多是一位和蔼可亲的人.

sentence.Network_en: The latter's genial nature and dressy appearance pleased him.
sentence.Network_cn: 杜洛埃为人和气,衣着讲究,这些都很合他的意.

sentence.Network_en: He was a warm-hearted friend and genial host.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个热心的朋友，也是友善待客的主人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin genialis 'nuptial, productive', from genius (see genius). The Latin sense was adopted into English; hence the senses 'mild and conducive to growth' (mid 17th cent.), later 'cheerful, kindly' (mid 18th cent.)
mid 19th cent.: from Greek geneion 'chin' (from genus 'jaw') + -al

entry.tran: 友善的；真诚的；亲切的；和蔼可亲的
entry.def: Someone who is genial is kind and friendly.

example.ex: Bob was always genial and welcoming...
example.tran: 鲍勃总是那么友善热情。

example.ex: He was a warm-hearted friend and genial host.
example.tran: 他是个热心的朋友，也是友善待客的主人。

means.word_mean: 2. of or relating to the chin or median part of the lower jaw

sentences.sentence: "hot summer pavements are anything but kind to the feet"
